visual_content: A promotion box featuring a green 'chargers.com.au' logo, text 'Get 10% Discount On Your Order', a website address 'evchargers.com.au', and a discount code 'BF10' with a 'Tap To Copy' button. There are no faces or QR codes.
anomalies: The promotion directs users to an external website, 'evchargers.com.au', to 'shop' rather than providing a direct discount for charging at the kiosk. While potentially a legitimate partner, this diversion tactic can be used for phishing or directing users to unauthorized sites. Without context on the official domain of the charging network, this raises a flag regarding potential misdirection or unauthorized promotion.

visual_content: A promotional graphic branded 'ChargeHub' with the text 'SAVE 20% OFF YOUR FIRST CHARGE. Valid for new users only. Limited time offer.' Below, there is an image of a silver electric vehicle charging at a station. A promo code 'EVSTART20' with a 'COPY CODE' button and a URL 'chargehub.com/promos' with a barcode are also visible.
anomalies: None. The promotion, branding ('ChargeHub'), discount (20% off first charge), and associated URL appear legitimate and consistent with typical marketing for an EV charging service. There are no overt signs of deepfake or AI generation in the image, nor any unrealistic claims or phishing prompts.

visual_content: A promotion featuring the 'ChargeHub' logo, text 'SAVE 20% OFF YOUR FIRST CHARGE' (valid for new users, limited time offer), an image of a white electric vehicle charging at a station, a coupon code 'EVSTART20' with a 'COPY CODE' button, a generic barcode, and a URL 'charger-hub.com/promos'. Above this, a general banner states 'Special 10% Discount Available!'.
anomalies: There is a discrepancy between the 'Special 10% Discount Available!' banner and the promotion itself which offers 'SAVE 20% OFF YOUR FIRST CHARGE'. This inconsistency could be a sign of poor UI design or potentially deceptive advertising. The barcode appears to be a generic placeholder rather than a scannable, functional code, which might be an anomaly in a live system.

visual_content: A rectangular graphic featuring a '10% OFF EV CHARGING' promotion. The graphic is blue with large white text '10% OFF EV CHARGING' and smaller white text 'SAVE ON EV CHARGING'. An illustration of a green EV car with white charging symbols is positioned next to the 'EV' text.
anomalies: None. The discount is plausible, and the graphic appears standard and professionally integrated into the UI.

visual_content: A promotional graphic for 'ElectroCharge' featuring a silver/white EV car parked next to a charging station in an urban setting. Text promotes 'UNLOCK HUGE SAVINGS' and 'GET 30% OFF ALL CHARGES THIS MONTH' with a smaller disclaimer 'Limited-time offer for ElectroCharge members.' A promo code 'CHARGE30' and an 'APPLY NOW' button are visible, along with a barcode-like graphic at the bottom.
anomalies: The kiosk header states 'Special 10% Discount Available!', which contradicts the 'GET 30% OFF ALL CHARGES THIS MONTH' advertised within the promotion graphic. This inconsistency in discount percentages is a significant anomaly that could indicate misleading advertising or a potential phishing attempt to entice users with a higher discount than initially advertised.

visual_content: A promotional banner for 'gojek | CD ENGIE', identical to Kiosk 2. It offers '10% off EV charging' for 'Gojek driver-partners' with a graphic of a stylized green EV and charging station.
anomalies: None. This kiosk displays the same content as Kiosk 2, which appears legitimate with reasonable discounts and known branding.

visual_content: A generic graphic resembling a golden ticket or coupon with horizontal lines and two circular 'punch-holes' on the right side. Below the graphic, the text 'No Active Promotions' is displayed.
anomalies: None. The content explicitly states 'No Active Promotions' and uses a generic placeholder graphic, indicating a lack of dynamic promotional material at this time. There are no signs of manipulated images, suspicious offers, or phishing attempts.

visual_content: Yellow banner with text 'Special 10% Discount Available!'. A green box contains a logo featuring 'EVC Chargers' (partially visible), text stating 'Get 10% Discount On Your Order', and instructions to 'Copy the code and shop at evchargers.com.au'. Below this, a coupon code 'BF10' is displayed next to a 'Tap To Copy' button.
anomalies: The promotion directs users to an external website (evchargers.com.au). While the domain name appears to align with the 'EV Charging Network' context, it represents a potential phishing vector. Users are prompted to leave the current interface and visit an external site, which could be exploited by attackers using look-alike domains. Verification of the external URL's authenticity is crucial to prevent potential cyberattacks.
